member.name: M:KGySoft.Drawing.ImageExtensions.DrawInto(System.Drawing.Image,System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Drawing.Point,KGySoft.Drawing.Imaging.IQuantizer,KGySoft.Drawing.Imaging.IDitherer)
member.summary:
Draws the into the without scaling. This method is similar to Graphics.DrawImage methods, except that this one always preserves the source size in pixels, works between any pair of source and target s and supports quantizing and dithering. For scaling use the overloads with targetRectangle and parameters.
See the Remarks section for details.
member.param: The source to be drawn into the .
The target into which should be drawn.

The target location. Target size will be always the same as the source size. This parameter is optional.
Default value: Point.Empty.

An instance to be used for the drawing. If not specified, then the drawing operation might automatically pick a quantizer based on . This parameter is optional.
Default value: .

The ditherer to be used for the drawing. Might be ignored if is not specified and format has at least 24 bits-per-pixel size. This parameter is optional.
Default value: .

remarks.note: This method adjusts the degree of parallelization automatically, blocks the caller, and does not support cancellation or reporting progress. Use the BitmapDataExtensions.BeginDrawInto or BitmapDataExtensions.DrawIntoAsync (in .NET Framework 4.0 and above) methods for asynchronous call and to adjust parallelization, set up cancellation and for reporting progress.
remarks.para: The image to be drawn is automatically clipped if its size or makes it impossible to completely fit in the .

If can represent a narrower set of colors, then the result will be automatically quantized to the colors of the , even if there is no specified. To use dithering a must be explicitly specified though.
If is specified but it uses more/different colors than can represent, then the result will eventually quantized to , though the result may have a poorer quality than expected.
This overload does not resize the image even if and have different DPI resolution.

If is a non-indexed one, then specifies the quantizer to be used to determine the colors of the saved image. If , then the target colors will be optimized for the actual colors in the . This parameter is optional.
Default value: .

If a quantization has to be performed can specifies the ditherer to be used. If , then no dithering will be performed. This parameter is optional.
Default value: .

remarks.note: This method adjusts the degree of parallelization automatically, blocks the caller, and does not support cancellation or reporting progress. Use the GifEncoder.BeginEncodeImage or GifEncoder.EncodeImageAsync (in .NET Framework 4.0 and above) methods for asynchronous call and to adjust parallelization, set up cancellation and for reporting progress.
remarks.para: The can be saved even without a registered GIF encoder in the current operating system. To save the GIF image, the class is used internally.
If is an animated GIF, then the whole animation will be saved (can depend on the operating system).
The GIF format supports single bit transparency only.

If is and has a non-indexed pixel format, then a quantizer is automatically selected for optimizing the palette. The auto selected quantizer is obtained by the PredefinedColorsQuantizer.Grayscale method for the pixel format, and by the OptimizedPaletteQuantizer.Wu method for any other pixel formats.
If is , then no ditherer will be auto-selected for the quantization.

member.exception: No built-in encoder was found or the saving fails in the current operating system.

member.name: M:KGySoft.Drawing.ImageExtensions.SaveAsAnimatedGif(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Drawing.Image},System.IO.Stream,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.TimeSpan},KGySoft.Drawing.Imaging.IQuantizer,KGySoft.Drawing.Imaging.IDitherer)
member.summary:
Saves the provided as a looping GIF animation into the specified . When instances in contain already multiple frames, only the current frame is taken.
See the Remarks section for details.
member.param: The frames to save into the GIF data stream.
The stream into the GIF data is to be saved.

The collection of the delays to be used for the animation. If or empty, then a default 100 ms delay will be used for all frames. If contains less elements than , then the last value will be re-used for the remaining frames.

An optional quantizer to be used for the frames. If , then for frames with a non-indexed pixel format a quantizer returned by the OptimizedPaletteQuantizer.Wu method will be used. This parameter is optional.
Default value: .

An optional ditherer to be used when quantizing the frames. This parameter is optional.
Default value: .

remarks.note: This method adjusts the degree of parallelization automatically, blocks the caller, and does not support cancellation or reporting progress. Use the GifEncoder.BeginEncodeAnimation or GifEncoder.EncodeAnimationAsync (in .NET Framework 4.0 and above) methods for asynchronous call and to adjust parallelization, set up cancellation and for reporting progress.
remarks.para: When contain multi-frame instances, this method takes only the current frame. You can extract images by the ExtractBitmaps extension method.
The enumerator of is evaluated in a lazy manner. You can even dispose the previous image once the next one is queried.
Though this method does not support reporting progress directly, you can pass an iterator to the parameter that can track how many images have already been processed.
The resolution of the animation is determined by the first frame. If subsequent frames have different sizes, then they will be centered.
If supports an optimized palette for each frames (like ), then some frames of the animation might have even more than 256 colors (depending on the differences between frames).
remarks.note: To customize looping mode, frame size handling, delta frames strategy, etc., then use directly the class and its EncodeAnimation method. And for low level encoding you can instantiate the class and add the frames manually.

member.name: M:KGySoft.Drawing.ImageExtensions.SaveAsHighColorGif(System.Drawing.Image,System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean,System.Drawing.Color,System.Byte)
member.summary:
Encodes the specified as a multi-layered, single frame GIF image and writes it into the specified , preserving its original color depth.
See the Remarks section for details.
member.param: The to save. If contains multiple images or frames, then only the current image or frame will be saved.
The stream to save the image into.

to allow scanning the whole image for each layers to be able to re-use the local palette of the current layer.
to expand the initial layer area to the local pixels only. This parameter is optional.
Default value: .

Colors with alpha (transparency), whose Color.A property is equal to or greater than will be blended with this color during the encoding. The alpha value (Color.A property) of the specified background color is ignored. This parameter is optional.
Default value: , which has the same RGB values as .

Specifies a threshold value for the Color.A property, under which a pixel is considered transparent. If 0, then the final composite image will not have transparent pixels. This parameter is optional.
Default value: 128.

remarks.note: This method adjusts the degree of parallelization automatically, blocks the caller, and does not support cancellation or reporting progress. Use the GifEncoder.BeginEncodeHighColorImage or GifEncoder.EncodeHighColorImageAsync (in .NET Framework 4.0 and above) methods for asynchronous call and to set up cancellation or for reporting progress.

This method produces a GIF image that may have compatibility issues. Though the and types (at least in Windows) support them as expected as well as applications built on GDI+ (such as Windows Paint), many decoders may treat the result as an animation (including browsers).
remarks.para: If is , then both the processing time and memory usage is higher. It helps to minimize the number of layers of the final image; however, the final image size will not be necessarily smaller, especially for true color images.

If is , then each layer is attempted to be as compact as possible. It allows a very fast processing with lower memory usage. Though it usually produces more layers, the final size will not be necessarily larger, especially for true color images.
remarks.note: You can prequantize true color images using a 16-bit quantizer (with or without dithering) to produce fairly compact, still high color GIF images. For such images the parameter with value typically produces more compact results. You can consider using the Argb1555 quantizer for images with transparency, or the Rgb565 quantizer for non-transparent images.
remarks.para: To create a multi-layered image completely manually you can create a instance that provides a lower level access.

member.summary: Represents a provider for progress updates for drawing operations.

member.name: M:KGySoft.Drawing.IDrawingProgress.Report(KGySoft.Drawing.DrawingProgress)
member.summary: Reports a progress update to any arbitrary state. For parallel operations it is recommended to use the Increment method after starting a new progress because this method cannot guarantee that will be a strictly increasing value when called from members, for example.
member.param: The value of the updated progress.

member.name: M:KGySoft.Drawing.IDrawingProgress.New(KGySoft.Drawing.DrawingOperation,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Indicates that a new progress session is started that consists of .
member.param: Type of the new operation.

Specifies the possible maximum steps of the new operation (the Increment method is expected to be called later on as many times as the value of this parameter). 0 means an operation with no separate steps. This parameter is optional.
Default value: 0.

Specifies the initial current value for the new progress. Should be between 0 and . This parameter is optional.
Default value: 0.

member.name: M:KGySoft.Drawing.IDrawingProgress.Increment
member.summary: Indicates a progress update of a single step. Expected to be called after the New or Report methods with nonzero maximum steps but should not be sensitive for concurrency racing conditions.

member.name: M:KGySoft.Drawing.IDrawingProgress.SetProgressValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Indicates that the current progress is at a specific position.
member.param: The current progress value. Should not exceed the maximum value of the last New or Report calls but should not be sensitive for concurrency racing conditions.

member.name: M:KGySoft.Drawing.IDrawingProgress.Complete
member.summary: Indicates that a progress value of the last New or Report method should be set to the maximum value. It is not needed to be called at the end of each sessions.

member.name: T:KGySoft.Drawing.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The KGySoft.Drawing namespace contains extension methods and types built around the types of the System.Drawing namespace. Among others, provides advanced support for the type such as extracting, combining and converting multi-resolution icons, including hi-resolution ones, supports saving several formats, including formats without built-in encoders (eg. icons and s), provides methods for pixel format conversion, quantizing, dithering, etc.
